meanings.definition: Direct one's hopes or ambitions toward achieving something.
meanings.sent1: I aspire to become a doctor and help people.
meanings.sent2: She aspires to be a famous singer one day.
meanings.sent3: Even the little bird seemed to aspire to reach the highest branch of the tree.
meanings.sent4: Her dreams of success aspire like a rocket launching into the sky.
meanings.sent5: His determination to succeed made his aspirations shine brightly.

meanings.sent1: The tall skyscraper seemed to aspire above the city skyline.
meanings.sent2: The mountains aspire majestically towards the sky.
meanings.sent3: The cake was so fluffy that it appeared to aspire above the plate.
meanings.sent4: The flames of the bonfire aspire towards the stars in the night sky.
meanings.sent5: The towering tree seemed to aspire towards the heavens with its branches reaching high.
